Student Portal¶

The student portal is made up of four HTML pages:

  • Home Page – 4-Year Module Plan
  • View Module Page – Module Information
  • Module by Tags Page – Search for Modules by Tags
  • Graduation Progress Page – Track the modules that an individual has cleared in relation to his graduation requirements

Home Page¶

script.searchModules(search_id)¶

Searches for all modules on the page and links them to their respective view-module pages

script.methods.sumMCs()¶

Checks the MC for each module per semester and sums it

script.methods.changeGrade()¶

Lets the user input the grade for each module

script.methods.calcCAP()¶

Calculates cap of the individual, given the user’s input grades and total number of graded modules

script.methods.resetInfo()¶

Resets the schedule to the default

script.methods.syncModules()¶

Syncs the timetable with the latest timetable on firebase

script.methods.selectElective()¶

Adds module into timetable when selected on the recommended list

script.methods.remove()¶

Removes module into timetable when deleted

script.methods.addRecommendation()¶

Adds module into recommendation list

script.methods.swapGeneralMod()¶

Replaces general module with selected module when clicked Removes the selected module from suggestion list Calls syncModules

View Module Page¶

search.search(param)¶

Looks for tags in the nusmods module list that matches the input module code by user

Arguments:
  • param (string) – input text that was searched
view-module.getModuleInfo(module_code)¶

Loaded by View Module Tab, to get module description.

Pulls data from the /backend/module_description/ endpoint.

view-module.getPrereqs(module_code)¶

Loaded by view module tab, to get pre-requistes of each module, as documented in nusmods API.

Pulls data from the /backend/student/view-module/ endpoint.

Calls treeStuff()

view-module.getSEPUni(module_code)¶

Loaded by view module tab, to get the partner university for each module.

Pulls data from the /backend/student/SEP/ endpoint.

Calls searchUni()

view-module.searchModules()¶

Loaded by view module tab, to get the partner university for each module.

Pulls data from the /backend/student/SEP/ endpoint.

Charts and Diagrams¶

These functions are used to display charts & diagrams in the View Module page:

view-module.treeStuff(treeData)¶

Creates a tree at a given div

Arguments:
  • treeData (dictionary) – with key value pair as name: module code, parent: post-requisite, and children: list of pre-requistes
view-module.wordcloud(listword, id, colorRange)¶

Creates a wordcloud at a given div

Arguments:
  • listword (list) – List of words in the wordcloud
  • id (string) – HTML id of div to place chart in
  • colorRange (list) – List of colours in Hex Code
view-module.barReviewChart(id, labels, data)¶

Creates a bar Review Chart chart at a given div

Arguments:
  • id (string) – HTML id of div to place chart in
  • labels (list) – List of labels
  • data (list) – Values

Module by Tags Page¶

search-tag.searchtagjs(param)¶

Looks for tags in the firebase that matches the input text

Arguments:
  • param (string) – input text that was searched
Returns:

list – list of tags that matches or contain the input text
view-tag.searchTags()¶

Looks for tag that was selected by user and links user to the view-tag page with the corresponding tag

view-tag.searchMod(results)¶

Find the modules that have the corresponding tag, and links it to the corresponding view-module page

view-tag.methods.increment()¶

Keep track of the number of times the tag was clicked in a local dictionary.

Graduation Progress Page¶

The Graduation Progress Page syncs with the Home Page to automatically update the student’s progress.

class grad.Requirement(details, req_num, field, subset, ofWhichs)¶
Arguments:
  • details (list) – List of requirements to be met
  • req_num (integer) – Number of the requirements that need to be met. Default: 1
  • field (string) – If applicable, what field to check for requirements (e.g. name, level). Default: name
  • subset (list) – List of module names which have to fulfill the requirements
  • ofWhichs (list) – List of further requirements that those who pass the first this requirement must fulfill
grad.displayRequirements()¶

Function to display all requirements in a table
